result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan D Madell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property (>$2500-$5000) [Modifiers: Repeater, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bf).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).ts, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Case re-called from earlier this morning. Defendant Ryan D Madell in court with attorney Meg C. O'Marro-Felli.  Defendant in custody. Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionaire previously filed. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty.

Defendant Ryan D Madell in court with attorney Meg C. O'Marro-Felli.  Defendant in custody from Kettle Moraine Correctional Institute. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives recommendation of withheld sentence; 3 years probation; 6 month condition time; restitution. Case to be recalled at 1:15pm for counsel to clarify offer with Atty Gerol.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Ryan D Madell in court with attorney Meg C O'Marro-Felli.  Defendant in custody. Carol B Crowley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel has received complaint and requests preliminary hearing and waives timelimits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

State by DA Jeffrey Sisley.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty Alme Boaz.  Counsel advises the defendant does qualify for representation, but may be a confict.  Counsel waives reading.  Court finds probable cause.  State advises defendant is on a probation hold, however, requesting $10,000 cash bail w/conditions.  Court orders $7500 cash bail w/conditions:  no contact with C.S. or her residence and C.K.  Counsel requesting status of prelim hrg; waiving timelimits.  Court orders matter adj to 6/10 at 10 am for status of prelim hrg.
